Class containing a prior distribution derived from life-history data

Source: R/prior-class.R, R/prior.R
prior-class.Rd

This is an S4 object class that includes both a numeric vector for storage of derived values generated using Monte Carlo methods, such as the intrinsic growth rate \(r\), and a list of parameters describing the associated parameteric distribution. Currently only a log-normal distribution is supported.

If length(x) > 1 then the function creates an object containing values of x, otherwise it creates a vector of zero's of length equal to x.

For example, values for \(r\) can be simulated directly or generated using the rCalc function. The class contains an additional slot to hold parameters of the log-normal distribution, which is used by bdm to describe the prior for \(r\).

Usage

prior(x, ...)

Arguments

x

either an integer specifiying the length of an empty vector or a vector of derived values

...

additional arguments to generic function

Slots

.Data

numeric vector of derived values

lognormal_par

log-normal distribution parameter values

Examples

# create object containing
# vector of r values
iter <- 100
mu <- 0.1
cv <- 0.2
sd <- sqrt(log(1+cv^2))
x <- rlnorm(iter,log(mu)-sd^2/2,sd)
r <- prior(x)
